alert.note: Alert for Lake; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 7:05PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Lake, Orange, Osceola, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Saint Cloud, Winter Park, DeLand, Casselberry, Maitland, Lake Mary, Longwood, Orange City, Wedgefield, Lake Helen, Windermere and Pierson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
